channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: What Harris Has to Do Next, and Fast
item.description: A good convention speech isn’t enough to earn the trust of voters.

item.title: Middle East Crisis: C.I.A. Chief Joins Cairo Talks in Push for Cease-Fire Deal
item.description: Mediators plan to move ahead with a summit next week in pursuit of a cease-fire agreement, officials said. “The process is moving forward,” a White Ho...

item.title: Italian prosecutor eyes possible manslaughter charges in Mike Lynch yacht sinking that killed 7
item.description: The public prosecutor of Termini Imerese has launched a probe into Mike Lynch's yacht shipwreck and multiple counts of culpable homicide, which is equ...

item.title: What to Know About the Business Execs Who Were With Mike Lynch on His Yacht
item.description: The two business figures, both associates of the tech mogul, went missing after the superyacht they were on sank off the coast of Sicily.

item.title: Russia Quashes Deadly Prison Mutiny by Islamist Inmates
item.description: The revolt is the latest in a series of terrorist attacks in Russia claimed by Islamic militants.

item.title: Campaign finance charges against girlfriend of FTX exec show political fallout from Bankman-Fried still ongoing
item.description: The Department of Justice charged the crypto lobbyist Michelle Bond of illegally financing her congressional campaign with FTX funds.

item.title: U.S. Accuses RealPage of Enabling Collusion on Rents in Antitrust Suit
item.description: The Justice Department filed an antitrust suit against the real estate software company, accusing it of creating an illegal pricing scheme to charge t...

item.title: Iceland Volcano Erupts for Sixth Time in Less Than a Year
item.description: A volcano in Iceland near the town of Grindavik erupted on Thursday. Experts say the zone may continue to generate eruptions for years, potentially le...

item.title: Pakistan’s first Olympic winner in 32 years was rewarded with almost $1 million—and a buffalo
item.description: 27-year-old javelin thrower Arshad Nadeem was also given a Honda Civic.

item.title: As Ukraine Pushes Into Russia, Its Next Steps Are Unclear
item.description: American officials are not convinced that Ukraine intends to hold its position in Russia long term.

item.title: With $20 Billion Weapons Deal, U.S. Aims to Help Israel and Deter Iran
item.description: The White House has told Congress it is allowing the sale of $20 billion in arms to Israel. Here’s what’s in the package.

item.title: Fed chair’s ‘unmistakably dovish’ tone gives investors hope for a mega rate cut next month
item.description: “The time has come for policy to adjust,” Powell said in his Jackson Hole speech on Friday.

item.title: Families of Dead Hostages Vent Anger at Israeli Leaders Over War
item.description: After Israel recovered the bodies of six men who died in Hamas captivity in Gaza, survivors accused the government of sinking the chances of hostages ...

item.title: Deadly Floods Hit Bangladesh
item.description: The disaster adds to the challenges of Bangladesh’s interim government, which has struggled to restore order after its longtime prime minister fled th...

item.title: When will the fall COVID-19 vaccines be available?
item.description: FDA approved the new vaccination Thursday.
